results.title: Tokyo story = Tokyo monogatari
results.brief_description: Ozu considered what many regard as his finest film to be about the disintegration of the Japanese family system. Ordinary family events - the visit of parents to see the children and their cool reception - are profoundly moving as Ozu portrays them. ‘Tokyo Story’ is actually a recasting of Leo McCarey’s ‘Make Way For Tomorrow’ which his collaborator, Noda, had seen but Ozu had not. As in most of his later films there is a pervasive nostalgia, a sense of loss. Although a loosely plotted leisurely survey of the extended family structured around journeys, the film is full of conflicts triggered by the grandparents’ visit in which characterisation both enriches and qualifies stark thematic oppositions.

results.title: Simba
results.creator_credit: Brian Hurst, Peter de Sarigny and Group Film Productions
results.brief_description: Allan Howard (Dirk Bogarde) arrives in Kenya to join his brother on the farm; tragedy awaits him when he discovers that his brother has been brutally murdered by the nationalistic Mau Mau tribe. He finds solace, and eventually love with neighbour Mary Crawford (Virginia McKenna). Alan works with the local Police Inspector (Donald Sinden), and together they suspect that the local African doctor, known only as Simba, is the leader behind the Mau Mau terrorist attacks. They must now play a tense waiting game. Based on actual events that occurred to British settlers in Kenya in the 1950s.

results.title: The Parent trap
results.brief_description: A summer camp turns into a life altering adventure when two long lost twin sisters (both played by Hayley Mills), are reunited. Together the newly formed friends devise a fiendish plot to rekindle the romance between their separated parents and live as one happy family. With two minds on the job there’s double the chance of success! Cast includes Maureen O’Hara, Brian Keith, Charlie Ruggles and Una Merkel. Based on the novel ‘Das Doppelte lottchen’ by Erich Kastner.

results.title: Up close & personal (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jon Avnet, David Nicksay, Jordan Kerner and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: From humble beginnings, Sally Atwater (Michelle Pfeiffer) is about to hit the big time. Arriving from a trailer park in Nevada, an overeager and overdressed weather girl, she makes a disastrous debut on national television. All is not lost however as her passion for the job captures the eye of the experienced, and handsome newsman, Warren Justice (Robert Redford). With Warren’s help Sally is transformed, Pygmalian style, into a popular and respected journalist. Along the way romance develops, but this is threatened by Sally’s newfound success and they must find a balance between love and their successful careers. Cast includes Stockard Channing, Joe Mantegna and Kate Nelligan.

results.title: The Well
results.creator_credit: Samantha Lang, Sandra Levy, Film Finance Corporation Australia, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description: Hester (Pamela Rabe) is a lonely woman who has spent all her life on her father’s farm in outback NSW. Katherine (Miranda Otto), is a young woman alone in the world until she comes to live with Hester as her housemaid. The two form a happy friendship, until one night it all falls apart when Katherine runs over and kills a man. The haunting cinematography and strong acting performances produce a powerful tale of rural isolation and trust betrayed. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.

results.title: Hook
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Gerald Molen, Kathleen Kennedy and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Steven Spielberg filters J.M. Barrie’s ‘Peter Pan’ through a distinctly 90’s sensibility in ‘Hook’, a film of lost opportunities. Peter Pan has become Peter Banning (Robin Williams), a 40 year old lawyer with a permanent scowl on his face. Banning has lost all memory of being Peter Pan, and he is also in danger of losing his wife and children. When Peter and his family travel to London to visit Granny Wendy, Peter’s children are kidnapped by Captain Hook. As Peter recalls who he is and re-discovers his happy thoughts, he transforms into the Peter Pan of the past and goes to rescue his children. Cast includes Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.

results.title: Frankenstein's Great-aunt Tillie
results.creator_credit: Myron J. Gold and Tillie Productions
results.brief_description: Comical farce about descendants of Frankenstein’s creator returning to the town of Mucklefugger to live at their unclaimed estate. Aunt Tillie helps the wayward women of the town save their home; the Cradle, rebelling also against unscrupulous and incompetent town officials who endeavour to take over their estate. Accompanied by two lusty side-kicks, the film barely holds together with plot, digressing into many directions at times. Be warned, this is a silly movie. Cast includes Donald Pleasance, Yvonne Furneaux, Zsa Zsa Gabor and Miguel Angel Fuentes. WARNING: THE PICTURE JUMPS AT THE BEGINNING AND THERE IS SOME DROPOUT.

results.title: One fine day (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Hoffman, Lynda Obst and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An unlikely romance develops when two single parents share babysitting for a day. Melanie (Michelle Pfeiffer), is a single mother with a busy career as an architect. Jack (George Clooney), is a commitment-shy newspaper columnist who has access to his daughter on the weekends, although his ex-wife’s sudden elopement has Jack looking after his daughter during the week. When their children miss the boat for a class field trip, Jack and Melanie agree to share babysitting shifts, leading to a day of interesting and romantic developments as they struggle with their day to day work, the children, and the feelings that are developing between them. Cast includes Michelle Pfeiffer, George Clooney, Mae Whitman and Charles Durning.

results.title: Hustler white (E)
results.creator_credit: Bruce LaBruce, Rick Castro, Jurgen Bruning and Hustler White productions
results.brief_description: Co-director and star Bruce LaBruce’s sleazy and explicit tour of the LA hustler and porn scene is a humorous and twisted take on Billy Wilder’s “Sunset Boulevard and” the more unsavory moments of “Whatever happened to Baby Jane”. Model Tony Ward stars as Monti- a hustler who becomes the lust object and obsession for Bruce Labruce’s melodramatic journalist, Jurgen Anger. “Hustler White“‘s use of real life hustlers and gay porn actors, along with Labruce’s own gay porn background (he has directed and stared in the underground and very pornographic, Super 8 1/2 and No Skin off my Arse) gives the film a candid documentary feel. Hustler White was co-directed by gay photographer Rick Castro.

results.title: Magical mystery tour
results.creator_credit: Bernard Knowles, George Harrison, John Lennon, Paul McCartney, Ringo Starr and Beatles
results.brief_description: Join The Beatles on an hallucinatory mystery tour to the tunes of “Baby your a rich man”, “Penny lane”, “Flying”, “The Fool on the hill”, “All you need is love”, “Strawberry fields forever”, “Blue jay way”, “Hello goodbye”, “I am the walrus”, “Your mother should know”, and “All my loving”.
